title: Authorizes a pooled purchasing program for certain services and commodities
summary: Authorizes a pooled purchasing program for certain services and commodities, including, but not limited to, liability and motor vehicle insurance.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2174

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 18, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sens. GOLDEN, JOHNSON -- read twice and ordered printed,
         and when printed to be committed to the Committee on Aging

       AN ACT to amend the elder law,  in  relation  to  authorizing  a  pooled
         purchasing program for certain services and commodities

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 8 of section 203 of the elder law, as added  by
    2  chapter  48  of the laws of 2007, is amended and a new subdivision 10 is
    3  added to read as follows:
    4    [8] 9.  The director of the office for the aging is hereby authorized,
    5  to the extent appropriations are available therefor, to establish, oper-
    6  ate and maintain, under the control of the office for the  aging  or  in
    7  conjunction with an association, institution, agency, or other public or
    8  private entity, or community program engaged in the care of animals, one
    9  or  more  senior pet companionship programs. The purpose and intent of a
   10  senior pet companionship program shall be  to  match  seniors  who  have
   11  limited  social  contact  with  pets,  including cats and dogs and other
   12  small animals, to improve the lives of such seniors by  enhancing  their
   13  emotional and mental well-being through such companionship.
   14    10.  IN  ADDITION  TO  THE  POWERS AND DUTIES CONTAINED IN SECTION TWO
   15  HUNDRED TWO OF THIS TITLE, THE OFFICE IS HEREBY AUTHORIZED TO ESTABLISH,
   16  OPERATE, COORDINATE, ENCOURAGE THE DEVELOPMENT OF, AND/OR  MAINTAIN,  OR
   17  TO  CONTRACT  WITH OTHER NOT-FOR-PROFIT OR FOR-PROFIT OR PUBLIC ENTITIES
   18  ON BEHALF OF THOSE ENTITIES, PROGRAMS, AND SERVICES FOR THE  AGING  OVER
   19  WHICH IT HAS JURISDICTION, OVERSIGHT, OR OTHER CONTRACTUAL RELATIONSHIP,
   20  FOR  THE  OPERATION  OF A POOLED PURCHASING PROGRAM FOR CERTAIN SERVICES
   21  AND COMMODITIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT  LIMITED  TO,  LIABILITY  AND  MOTOR
   22  VEHICLE  INSURANCE, AS SHALL BE DETERMINED BY THE OFFICE AFTER CONSULTA-
   23  TION WITH THE ADVISORY COMMITTEE FOR THE AGING AND  OTHERS.  THE  OFFICE
   24  SHALL  ESTABLISH  RULES AND REGULATIONS FOR THE OPERATION OF SUCH POOLED
   25  PURCHASING PROGRAMS IN WHICH IT IS INVOLVED.
   26    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04183-01-1
